In C and C++, when you use [varargs] (example: [printf])
  * float values are automatically promoted to double. This behavior is due to the 
  * default argument promotion rules in VariadicFunctions, which specify that float arguments are promoted to double. Therefore, when you pass a float to printf using %f, the float is automatically converted to double before it is passed to the function.
